summary.p: 294 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4570; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 20 lines per page; Dimensions: 200 x 335mm; Script style: kūfī; Date of production: 1004.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 24: "69 Y. 4570. Aynı. Kalın esmer kâğıt. 335mm boy ve 200mm eninde 294 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli kûfi yazı ile 140mm uzunl.[uğunda] 20 satır. Abu Bakr ʿAbd al-Malik … b. Muḥammed … dīnī tarafından 394 (1004) yılı Zilhiccesinde istinsah edilmiştir. Birinci sahifesi sonradan yazılmıştır. Serlevha müzehhep, sure başları ve duraklar yaldızla, secavend harfleri kırmızı ile yazılı. Miklep ve şemseli siyah deri sade cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "69 Y. 4570. Same. Thick brown paper. 294 leaves of 335 mm height and 200 mm width. The text area written with vowel marked Kufic script [contains] 20 lines measuring 140 mm. Copied by ʾAbū Bakr ʿAbd al-Mālik … ibn Muḥammad … dīnī, in the Islamic month of Ẕilḥijjah in the year 394 (1004). The first page has been written later. The first page (serlevha), sūra beginnings, and verse separators are gilded, and the sajāwand letters are written in red. Simple leather binding with flap (miklep) and mandorla (şemse)."
